description: Number of inequivalent sublattices of index n in hexagonal lattice (two sublattices are equivalent if one can be rotated or reflected to give the other).
comments: The hexagonal lattice is the familiar 2-dimensional lattice in which each point has 6 neighbors. This is sometimes called the triangular lattice.
references: A. Altshuler, Construction and enumeration of regular maps on the torus, Discrete Math. 4 (1973), 201-217.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
